data.title: Mordaunt: I won’t join this battle of black ops
data.meta_description: Penny Mordaunt has accused her leadership rivals of running a “black ops” campaign because they do not want to face her in the contest’s final round.The junior
data.text:
Penny Mordaunt has accused her leadership rivals of running a “black ops” campaign because they do not want to face her in the contest’s final round.

The junior trade minister and former defence secretary has emerged this week as a frontrunner to succeed Boris Johnson as prime minister, prompting frantic attempts from opponents, especially supporters of Liz Truss, the foreign secretary, to stall her momentum.

Mordaunt insisted yesterday she was unfazed by the attacks as she prepared for two televised debates that will shape MPs’ perceptions of the candidates before three of the five remaining contenders are eliminated next week.

“People obviously are trying to stop me getting into the final because they don’t want to run against me,” Mordaunt told Sky News. “People are
